commitResults.messageTitle: Move todo add logic into TaskList
A-Packages: organize classes into adolf package
Configure Gradle mainClass for adolf package (adolf.Adolf)
A-JUnit: add JUnit tests for Parser and TaskList

commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce a new updateDescription method in TaskList that allows
changing the description of an existing task without deleting and
recreating it. The method validates indices and ignores null/blank
descriptions so that existing tasks are not silently corrupted.

Also add a JUnit test to verify that updating a description changes
only the text while preserving the task count. This will be used by
a new C-Update command in a follow-up commit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add AI.md to document AI-assisted development
commitResults.messageBody:
The project uses AI tools for optional increments but has no
central record of where or how they were used.

The A-AiAssisted increment requires documenting AI assistance
(e.g. in code comments or an AI.md file).

Let's add an AI.md file that records the tool (Cursor), which
increments were assisted, and credit.

A single file keeps all credit in one place and matches the
alternative suggested in the increment instructions.

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Give Adolf a consistent task-buddy personality
commitResults.messageBody:
Adolf uses generic phrasing and has no distinct GUI identity.

A unique personality improves UX and meets the A-Personality
increment (name, phrases, GUI).

Let's give Adolf a friendly "task buddy" voice: warmer greetings
and confirmations, "Oops —" for errors, and GUI styling (colors,
fonts, window title) in Main.

Keeping the name Adolf preserves branding; phrase tweaks apply
across CLI (Ui, Adolf) and GUI (AdolfBot, Main).

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Main: asymmetric chat bubbles and error highlighting
commitResults.messageBody:
The GUI shows user and bot messages in the same TextArea style.

Conversations are asymmetric (user vs app), so both sides should
not look the same. Errors also need to stand out.

Let's replace the single TextArea with distinct bubbles: user on
the right (e.g. light blue), bot on the left (e.g. gray). Show
error replies (e.g. starting with "Oops —") in a highlighted
style (e.g. light red with border). Allow window resizing and set
a minimum size so content resizes appropriately.

Bubbles and ScrollPane with fitToWidth/fitToHeight satisfy the
A-BetterGui minimal requirement (at least one of i–vi).

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle command format, env and data errors (A-MoreErrorHandling)
commitResults.messageBody:
Commands accept multiple or trailing spaces; storage can be missing
or unreadable; event dates can be invalid or reversed.

The product can encounter command-format, environment and data
errors. Handling them improves robustness and meets A-MoreErrorHandling.

Let's normalize input (trim and collapse spaces), reject duplicate
/by or /from /to in deadline/event, require event end after start in
CLI and bot, validate storage file content (skip bad lines and
invalid dates) and handle access-denied on load.

Normalizing in one place (Parser.normalizeInput) keeps behavior
consistent. Storage skips invalid lines so a partly corrupted file
still loads valid tasks.

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for Parser, TaskList and Adolf (A-MoreTesting)
commitResults.messageBody:
Test coverage is limited to parser helpers, task list operations
and date/format logic; GUI is omitted for manual testing.

More automated tests improve regression safety and meet
A-MoreTesting. GUI (Main, Launcher) remains manually tested.

Let's add tests for parseDeadline/parseEvent (valid and invalid,
duplicate parameters), TaskList addDeadline/addEvent/delete, and
Adolf parseDateOrDateTime and formatTaskForUi. Add a new AdolfTest
class for the static helpers.

JUnit is used for all testable logic; manual testing is still
expected for different OSes, resolutions and language settings.

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

The project has no dedicated user-facing guide for Adolf.

Users need a short, fit-for-purpose guide to run and use all
features. A-UserGuide requires the guide in docs/README.md (GFMD)
and the chatbot name stated clearly.

Let's add docs/README.md with the product name at the top,
quick start (GUI and CLI), and a Features section covering
list, todo, deadline, event, mark, unmark, delete, find and bye.
Include date format and data file location. Use GitHub Flavored
Markdown for structure and code examples.

Keeping it concise avoids overwhelming users; GitHub Pages can
publish from the docs/ folder when configured in repo settings.

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

Record AI assistance for the two latest increments so reuse and
credit remain documented as required.

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove root README and keep user guide in docs/
commitResults.messageBody:
The project root had a template README that still referenced Duke.

The user guide lives in docs/README.md; a root README is redundant
and can confuse which doc is authoritative.

Let's remove the root README so the canonical user guide is
docs/README.md (and GitHub Pages can serve it from /docs).

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

Resolve conflicts in ParserTest and TaskListTest by keeping both
master's tests (parseDeadline, parseEvent, addDeadline, addEvent,
delete) and C-Update's tests (parseUpdate, updateDescription).

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Main: expandable bubbles and auto-scroll, add Ui.png
commitResults.messageBody:
Message bubbles truncate content when tasks exceed visible space,
and new messages don't auto-scroll into view.

Users need to see all content without compression (like WhatsApp),
and the chat should scroll to show the latest message automatically.

Let's replace Label with TextFlow so bubbles expand to fit all
content without truncation. Add a height listener on chatContent
to auto-scroll to bottom when new messages are added. Also add
Ui.png screenshot showing the full GUI with realistic data.

TextFlow wraps naturally and expands vertically; the height listener
triggers after layout completes, ensuring reliable auto-scroll.

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Javadoc comments to public methods and classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Add missing Javadoc comments to ensure at least half of public
methods and classes are documented, meeting implementation
requirements for code quality and documentation standards.

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Update AI.md to document implementation requirements compliance work
commitResults.messageBody:
Add section documenting AI assistance in ensuring compliance with
implementation requirements, specifically Javadoc additions.

Co-authored-by: Cursor <cursoragent@cursor.com>
